result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler Allen Larsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $8.00 paid directly to the Clerk of Court's Office prior to sentencing.  The 10% surcharge in the amount of $.80 still due and owing - same repayment conditions apply as noted below for the Costs.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler Allen Larsen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Has been serving a sentence and will be released Aug 25, 2017. Must make payments of $100/month starting Oct 1, 2017

Case called @ 2:28 Defendant Tyler Allen Larsen in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. No statement by DE. Court orders: Restitution in the amount of $8.00, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Tyler Allen Larsen in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE does qualify for SPD. Atty Szilagyi requesting 30 days for STC.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 2:18 PM: Defendant Tyler Allen Larsen in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - referred to SPD.  NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 02:40 pm.
